meanings.definition: To place or deal with close together for contrasting effect.
meanings.sent1: She juxtaposes the colors red and blue in her painting.
meanings.sent2: The artist juxtaposes light and dark shades to create depth.
meanings.sent3: The chef juxtaposes sweet and savory flavors in her signature dish.
meanings.sent4: The author juxtaposes hope and despair in her novel.
meanings.sent5: The photographer juxtaposes old and new architecture in his cityscape.

meanings.definition: To compare or contrast two things.
meanings.sent1: He juxtaposes the prices of different brands before making a purchase.
meanings.sent2: The teacher juxtaposes the themes of two poems in her lesson.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully juxtapose their favorite ice cream flavors.
meanings.sent4: The journalist juxtaposes the opinions of experts in the article.
meanings.sent5: The scientist juxtaposes the results of the two experiments for analysis.
